name: St. Antoine Daniel

locations.description: Jesuit missionary, one of the North American Martyrs in Canada

summary: Antoine Daniel was a French Jesuit priest and martyr who worked as a missionary among the Huron people in New France (Canada). He was a skilled teacher and established a school for Huron children. When the Iroquois attacked the mission at Teanaostaye, he was killed while celebrating Mass. He is one of the North American Martyrs and is remembered for his educational work and his dedication to the Huron people.
